mealSections.mealObjective: Kickstart metabolism, replenish glycogen, initiate muscle protein synthesis, and provide sustained energy to start the day.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 1: Whey Protein & Oats Porridge
ingredients: Whey Protein Powder (vanilla or unflavored): 1 scoop (30g powder)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Combine rolled oats and almond milk in a saucepan or microwave-safe bowl. Cook oats as per package instructions or microwave for 2-3 minutes. Once cooked, stir in whey protein powder and cinnamon. Mix well until protein is fully dissolved and porridge is creamy.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Whey protein is rapidly absorbed, excellent for morning protein. Oats provide sustained energy.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 2: Paneer & Brown Bread Toast
mealOptions.prepOverview: Toast bread. Mix paneer with mustard. Spread on toast. Top with tomatoes. Grill briefly if desired.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Brown bread fiber, Paneer casein protein, Mustard flavor boost.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 3: Chickpea Flour (Besan) Pancakes with Paneer
mealOptions.prepOverview: Mix chickpea flour and water to form a batter. Add chopped onion. Heat a non-stick pan, pour batter to make pancakes. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Serve with crumbled paneer as topping/filling.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Chickpea flour is protein-rich and gluten-free. Savory pancakes offer a different breakfast style.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 4: Overnight Oats with Peanut Butter & Banana
ingredients: Whey Protein Powder (optional, vanilla): 1/2 scoop (15g powder)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Mix oats, almond milk, and protein powder (if using) in a jar or container. Refrigerate overnight. In the morning, top with peanut butter and sliced banana.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Cold oats are convenient and creamy. Peanut butter adds healthy fats and flavor.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 5: Brown Bread Upma with Vegetables & Paneer
mealOptions.prepOverview: Lightly toast bread cubes in a pan. In the same pan, sauté onions and vegetables. Add paneer cubes and toasted bread. Mix well and cook for a few minutes until heated through. Season with spices (optional).
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Upma is a savory breakfast dish. Using brown bread makes it fiber-rich.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 6: Protein Smoothie with Berries & Oats
mealOptions.prepOverview: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Add more almond milk for desired consistency.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Smoothie is a quick and nutrient-dense breakfast. Berries add antioxidants.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 7: Lentil and Vegetable Soup (Breakfast Soup)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Rinse lentils. Sauté chopped vegetables in a pot. Add lentils, broth, and spices. Simmer until lentils are soft and soup thickens.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Lentil soup is warming and filling. Savory breakfast option, common in some cultures.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 8: Paneer Scramble with Tomatoes & Onions
mealOptions.prepOverview: Heat olive oil in a pan. Sauté onions and tomatoes. Add crumbled paneer and cook until heated through. Season with spices (optional).
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Paneer scramble is a high-protein, low-carb breakfast. Similar to egg scramble in concept.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 9:  Greek Yogurt Bowl with Apple & Cinnamon
mealOptions.prepOverview: Place Greek yogurt in a bowl. Top with diced apple and cinnamon. Drizzle honey if desired.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Greek yogurt probiotics, Apple fiber, Cinnamon flavor and potential blood sugar benefits.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 10: Brown Rice Porridge with Milk & Honey
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook brown rice until soft and slightly mushy (porridge consistency). Mix with milk and honey. Sprinkle cinnamon. Can be served warm or cold.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Brown rice porridge is a traditional comfort food. Provides sustained energy and is easily digestible.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 11: Peanut Butter & Banana Sandwich on Brown Bread
mealOptions.prepOverview: Spread peanut butter on brown bread slices. Layer banana slices on one slice and top with the other.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Classic combination. Peanut butter healthy fats & protein, Banana potassium, Brown bread fiber.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 12: Cottage Cheese & Tomato Rice Cakes
mealOptions.prepOverview: Spread cottage cheese on rice cakes. Top with tomato slices and basil (if using).
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Rice cakes light carbs, Cottage cheese casein, Tomato vitamins.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 13: Whey Protein Pancake (Oats Based)
ingredients: Rolled Oats (powdered): 30g (grind rolled oats in blender)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Mix powdered oats, protein powder, almond milk, and cinnamon to form a batter. Heat a non-stick pan. Pour batter to make pancakes. Cook until golden brown on both sides.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Protein pancakes are a healthier alternative to regular pancakes. Oats provide fiber, whey protein boosts protein content.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 14: Moong Dal Cheela (Pancake)
mealOptions.prepTime: 25 mins (including soaking time if using whole moong dal)
ingredients: Moong Dal (Split Yellow Gram): 50g (soaked for 2-3 hours or use Moong Dal flour)
Spices (Ginger, Garlic, Chili - optional): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: If using whole moong dal, soak, then blend with water to a smooth batter. If using moong dal flour, mix with water to batter consistency. Add chopped onion and spices. Heat non-stick pan, pour batter to make cheelas (thin pancakes). Cook until golden brown.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Moong dal is a light and digestible legume. Cheelas are a savory and nutritious breakfast option.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 15: Quinoa Porridge with Milk & Berries
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook quinoa with water until soft (porridge consistency). Mix cooked quinoa with milk and berries. Drizzle honey if desired. Serve warm or cold.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Quinoa is a complete protein source (for a grain). Berries add antioxidants and flavor.

mealSections.mealObjective: Sustain energy, stabilize blood sugar, control hunger until lunch, and continue protein supply.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 1: Greek Yogurt with Berries
mealOptions.prepOverview: Place Greek yogurt in a bowl. Top with mixed berries and cinnamon.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Greek yogurt protein & probiotics, Berries antioxidants & fiber.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 2: Whey Protein Shake with Banana
ingredients: Whey Protein Powder (vanilla or flavor of choice): 1 scoop (30g powder)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Blend/shake protein powder, banana, and almond milk/water.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Quick protein & carb boost. Banana potassium & energy.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 3: Apple Slices with Peanut Butter
mealOptions.prepOverview: Slice apple. Spread peanut butter on slices. Sprinkle cinnamon if desired.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Apple fiber & vitamins, Peanut butter healthy fats & some protein.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 4: Cottage Cheese with Peach Slices (or Orange Segments)
ingredients: Peach (or Orange): 1 medium peach (or 1 orange) sliced/segmented
mealOptions.prepOverview: Place cottage cheese in a bowl. Top with peach/orange slices. Sprinkle cinnamon.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Cottage cheese casein protein, Peach/Orange vitamins & natural sweetness.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 5: Protein Yogurt (Whey Protein mixed in Yogurt)
ingredients: Whey Protein Powder (vanilla or unflavored): 1/2 scoop (15g powder)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Mix whey protein powder into Greek yogurt. Add a splash of almond milk if needed for smoother consistency.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Double protein dose from yogurt and whey. Quick and easy snack.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 6: Handful of Almonds with Orange
mealOptions.prepOverview: Portion out almonds. Peel and eat orange.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Almonds healthy fats & fiber, Orange vitamin C & hydration.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 7: Rice Cakes with Peanut Butter & Banana Slices
mealOptions.prepOverview: Spread peanut butter on rice cakes. Top with banana slices.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Rice cakes light carbs, Peanut butter fats & protein, Banana potassium.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 8: Low-Fat Cheese (Mozzarella/Feta) Cubes with Tomato Slices
ingredients: Low-Fat Mozzarella or Feta Cheese, cubed: 70g
Basil (optional): a few leaves or dried
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cube cheese. Slice tomatoes. Combine cheese and tomato slices. Sprinkle basil if using.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Cheese protein & calcium, Tomato vitamins. Savory snack option.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 9: Sprouted Chickpeas Salad (Simple)
mealOptions.prepTime: 5 mins (sprouts need pre-sprouting, which takes 1-2 days)
ingredients: Lemon Juice: 1 tsp (optional, for dressing - acceptable condiment)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Combine sprouted chickpeas, chopped tomato, and onion. Add lemon juice for dressing if desired.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Sprouted chickpeas nutrient-dense & digestible, Salad provides fiber & freshness.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 10: Whey Protein Pudding (using Dairy Milk)
ingredients: Whey Protein Powder (vanilla or flavor of choice): 1 scoop (25g powder)
Cinnamon or Vanilla Extract (optional): a pinch
mealOptions.prepOverview: Mix whey protein powder with milk in a bowl. Stir well to dissolve protein. Refrigerate for at least 15-20 minutes to thicken into a pudding consistency. Add cinnamon/vanilla for flavor.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Protein pudding is a dessert-like snack with high protein. Milk adds creaminess.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 11: Orange and Cottage Cheese Snack
mealOptions.prepOverview: Peel and segment orange. Serve cottage cheese alongside orange segments. Sprinkle cinnamon on cottage cheese or orange.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Vitamin C from orange aids in iron absorption (if consumed with iron-rich meal later). Cottage cheese casein protein.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 12:  Banana "Nice Cream" (Protein Boosted)
mealOptions.prepTime: 10 mins (freezing time required for banana - pre-prep)
ingredients: Frozen Banana slices: 1 medium banana (approx. 100g, frozen beforehand)
Almond Milk (optional, if needed for blending): 20-30ml
mealOptions.prepOverview: Blend frozen banana slices and whey protein powder in a food processor or high-powered blender until smooth and ice cream-like consistency. Add a splash of almond milk if needed to help blend.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: "Nice cream" is a healthy ice cream alternative. Banana provides sweetness and creamy texture. Whey protein boosts protein content.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 13:  Rice Cakes with Salsa & Cottage Cheese
mealOptions.prepOverview: Spread cottage cheese on rice cakes. Top with salsa.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Savory snack. Salsa adds flavor and vegetables (tomato, onion). Cottage cheese casein protein.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 14:  Pinto Bean Dip with Rice Cakes
mealOptions.prepTime: 10 mins (if using canned beans, otherwise longer if cooking beans from scratch)
ingredients: Pinto Beans (canned, drained and rinsed or cooked): 80g
mealOptions.prepOverview: Mash pinto beans with a fork. Mix in salsa and spices (if using). Spread bean dip on rice cakes.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Bean dip provides fiber and plant-based protein. Rice cakes are a light base.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 15:  Milk (or Almond Milk) with Cinnamon & Honey
mealOptions.prepOverview: Heat milk (optional, can be cold). Stir in honey and cinnamon.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Warm milk (or cold) can be comforting. Cinnamon may have blood sugar regulating properties. Honey provides slight sweetness.

mealSections.mealObjective: Refuel energy stores, provide substantial protein for muscle maintenance and growth, and sustain satiety into the afternoon.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 1: Soya Chunks & Brown Rice Bowl
ingredients: Spices (Turmeric, Cumin, Garlic powder): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Soak soya chunks, cook rice. Sauté onions, add veggies & soya chunks, spices. Cook till veggies tender. Serve with rice.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Soya chunks plant-based protein, Brown rice complex carbs & fiber.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 2: Lentil Soup with Whole-Grain Bread
ingredients: Spices (Cumin, Turmeric, Ginger powder): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Rinse lentils. Sauté onions & carrots. Add lentils, broth, spices. Simmer till lentils soft. Serve with bread.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Lentils protein & fiber, Whole-grain bread complex carbs & fiber.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 3: Chickpea Curry with Quinoa
ingredients: Spices (Curry powder, Garam Masala, Ginger, Garlic): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook quinoa. Sauté onions, add tomatoes and spices. Add chickpeas and cook in spice base. Serve with quinoa.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Chickpeas plant-based protein & fiber, Quinoa complete protein & gluten-free grain.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 4: Paneer Tikka Salad with Brown Rice
ingredients: Mixed Vegetables (Bell Peppers, Onions, Tomatoes, Broccoli, Cauliflower), chopped: 100g
Spices (Turmeric, Paprika, Ginger, Garlic powder): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Marinate paneer in yogurt & spices, grill or pan-fry as tikka. Toss cooked brown rice and mixed vegetables. Top with paneer tikka.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Paneer tikka flavorful protein, Brown rice complex carbs, Salad veggies vitamins & fiber.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 5: Kidney Bean Chili with Brown Rice Cakes
ingredients: Kidney Beans (canned, drained & rinsed or cooked): 150g
Spices (Chili powder, Cumin, Oregano): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Sauté onions, add tomatoes and spices. Add kidney beans and simmer as chili. Serve with brown rice cakes.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Kidney beans plant-based protein & fiber, Brown rice cakes light carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 6: Moong Dal (Split Yellow Gram) Khichdi with Vegetables
ingredients: Spices (Turmeric, Cumin, Ginger, Salt): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Rinse moong dal and rice. Sauté vegetables in oil with spices. Add dal, rice, and water. Cook as khichdi until soft and mushy.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Khichdi is a comforting and easily digestible dish. Moong dal & rice provide balanced protein and carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 7: Pinto Bean and Corn Salad with Quinoa
ingredients: Pinto Beans (canned, drained & rinsed or cooked): 100g
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook quinoa. Mix cooked quinoa with pinto beans, corn, and onion. Dress with salsa and olive oil.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Pinto beans & quinoa plant-based protein, Corn & quinoa carbs, Salad fresh and light.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 8: Urad Dal (Black Gram) and Vegetable Curry with Brown Rice
ingredients: Urad Dal (Black Gram): 60g (dry weight, soaked and cooked)
Spices (Ginger, Garlic, Garam Masala, Turmeric): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook urad dal. Sauté onions, add tomatoes & vegetables, spices. Add cooked dal and simmer as curry. Serve with brown rice.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Urad dal protein & fiber, Brown rice complex carbs, Curry flavorful and hearty.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 9: Cottage Cheese (Paneer) and Vegetable Stir-fry with Brown Rice
ingredients: Mixed Vegetables (Broccoli, Cauliflower, Carrots, Onions, Bell Peppers), chopped: 150g
mealOptions.prepOverview: Stir-fry vegetables in olive oil with ginger and garlic. Add paneer cubes and soy sauce. Cook until paneer is lightly browned and vegetables are tender-crisp. Serve with brown rice.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Stir-fry quick and nutritious, Paneer protein, Brown rice carbs & fiber.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 10: Black Bean Burgers (Lentil & Rice Cake base) on Brown Bread
ingredients: Black Beans (canned, drained & rinsed or cooked): 150g
Spices (Cumin, Paprika, Garlic powder): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Mash black beans and lentils. Mix with crushed rice cakes, onions, and spices to form burger patties. Pan-fry or bake burgers. Serve in brown bread buns with tomato and onion slices.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Black bean & lentil burgers plant-based protein, Brown bread fiber, Burger fun and satisfying.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 11: Toor Dal (Pigeon Peas) with Brown Rice and Vegetables
ingredients: Toor Dal (Pigeon Peas): 60g (dry weight, soaked and cooked)
Spices (Turmeric, Mustard seeds, Curry leaves - if available, Ginger, Garlic): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook toor dal. Prepare vegetable tadka with mustard seeds, curry leaves (optional), ginger, garlic. Add vegetables and spices. Add cooked dal and simmer. Serve with brown rice.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Toor dal protein & fiber, Brown rice complex carbs, Dal with tadka flavorful and traditional.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 12: Split Peas Soup with Brown Bread
ingredients: Spices (Bay leaf, Thyme, Salt, Pepper): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Rinse split peas. Sauté onions & carrots. Add split peas, broth, spices. Simmer until peas are soft and soup thickens. Serve with brown bread.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Split peas protein & fiber, Brown bread complex carbs, Soup hearty and warming.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 13: Vegetable and Paneer Biryani with Greek Yogurt Raita
ingredients: Biryani Spices (Biryani Masala, Turmeric, Ginger, Garlic, Mint, Cilantro - acceptable herbs): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook basmati rice. Marinate paneer in biryani spices. Layer rice, vegetables, and paneer in a pot. Cook in layers (biryani style). Prepare raita by whisking Greek yogurt with salt and cumin. Serve biryani with raita.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Biryani flavorful and aromatic, Paneer protein, Rice carbs, Raita cooling and probiotic.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 14:  Paneer Bhurji with Brown Bread
ingredients: Spices (Turmeric, Chili powder, Coriander powder, Garam Masala): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Heat olive oil. Sauté onions and tomatoes. Add spices and crumbled paneer. Cook until paneer bhurji is ready. Serve with brown bread.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Paneer bhurji quick and easy, Paneer protein, Brown bread complex carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 15:  Quinoa Bowl with Roasted Vegetables & Chickpeas
ingredients: Mixed Vegetables (Broccoli, Cauliflower, Carrots, Onions), cut into pieces: 150g
Olive Oil: 2 tsp (10ml - for roasting and dressing)
Spices (Paprika, Garlic powder, Salt, Pepper): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Toss vegetables with 1 tsp olive oil and spices. Roast in oven or air fryer until tender. Cook quinoa. Combine cooked quinoa, roasted vegetables, and chickpeas. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and remaining 1 tsp olive oil.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Roasted vegetables flavorful and nutritious, Quinoa complete protein, Chickpeas plant-based protein & fiber, Bowl meal balanced and wholesome.

mealSections.mealObjective: Provide readily available energy for workout, maximize glycogen stores, and minimize digestive discomfort.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 1: Banana with Peanut Butter & Rice Cakes
ingredients: Peanut Butter (natural, no added sugar): 2 tbsp (32g)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Slice banana. Spread peanut butter on rice cakes. Top with banana slices.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Banana quick carbs & potassium, Peanut butter sustained energy.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 2: Whey Protein Shake with Brown Bread
ingredients: Whey Protein Powder (flavor of choice): 1 scoop (25g powder)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Prepare whey protein shake. Have with brown bread slice.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Whey protein muscle protection, Brown bread sustained carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 3: Banana Smoothie with Almond Milk & Honey
mealOptions.prepOverview: Blend banana, almond milk, and honey until smooth.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Banana quick carbs & potassium, Almond milk light liquid.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 4: Brown Rice with Banana and Cinnamon
mealOptions.prepTime: 15 mins (if rice is pre-cooked, otherwise longer)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Heat cooked brown rice (optional). Top with banana slices and cinnamon. Drizzle honey if desired.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Brown rice sustained carbs, Banana quick carbs & potassium, Cinnamon flavor & potential blood sugar regulation.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 5: Rice Cakes with Honey and Banana Slices
mealOptions.prepOverview: Spread honey on rice cakes. Top with banana slices.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Rice cakes light carbs, Honey quick energy, Banana potassium.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 6:  Whey Protein with Apple Slices
ingredients: Whey Protein Powder (flavor of choice): 1 scoop (25g powder)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Prepare whey protein shake with water or almond milk. Eat apple slices alongside.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Whey protein muscle protection, Apple fiber & quick carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 7:  Brown Bread with Mustard and Tomato
mealOptions.prepOverview: Toast brown bread lightly (optional). Spread mustard on bread slices. Top with tomato slices.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Brown bread sustained carbs, Tomato vitamins, Mustard flavor.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 8:  Rolled Oats with Water and Banana
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook rolled oats with water until soft. Top with banana slices.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Oats sustained carbs, Banana quick carbs & potassium.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 9:  Quinoa Flakes Porridge with Berries (small portion)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook quinoa flakes with water/almond milk until porridge consistency. Top with berries and honey if desired.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Quinoa flakes digestible carbs & some protein, Berries antioxidants.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 10:  Basmati Rice with Steamed Broccoli (small portion)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Steam broccoli until tender-crisp. Serve with cooked basmati rice. Season with salt and pepper.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Basmati rice easily digestible carbs, Broccoli vitamins & fiber.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 11:  Whey Protein Isolate Shake (for very low fat option) with Orange
ingredients: Whey Protein Isolate Powder (flavor of choice): 1 scoop (30g powder)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Prepare whey protein isolate shake with water. Eat orange alongside.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Whey protein isolate very low fat, Orange vitamins & quick carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 12:  Corn on the Cob (small) with Salsa
ingredients: Corn on the Cob: 1 small cob (approx. 150g cooked)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Boil or grill corn on the cob until cooked. Serve with salsa for dipping or topping.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Corn easily digestible carbs, Salsa adds flavor and vegetables.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 13:  Pinto Beans and Rice Cakes Mash
ingredients: Pinto Beans (canned, drained & rinsed or cooked): 100g
Salsa or Mustard: 2 tbsp (optional for flavor)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Mash pinto beans slightly. Mix with crushed rice cakes and salsa or mustard for flavor.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Pinto beans sustained carbs & some protein, Rice cakes light carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 14:  Apple and Cinnamon Oatmeal (Water based)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook rolled oats with water until soft. Stir in diced apple and cinnamon. Drizzle honey if desired.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Oats sustained carbs, Apple fiber & natural sweetness, Cinnamon flavor.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 15:  Grapes with Cottage Cheese (small portion - lower carb approach)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Wash grapes. Serve grapes alongside cottage cheese.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Grapes quick carbs, Cottage cheese protein. Lower carb pre-workout option for some individuals.

mealSections.mealObjective: Replenish glycogen, maximize muscle protein synthesis, reduce muscle breakdown, and promote recovery.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 1: Whey Protein Shake with Banana & Brown Rice
ingredients: Whey Protein Powder (flavor of choice): 1.5 scoops (approx. 45g powder)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Prepare whey protein shake. Serve with cooked brown rice and banana.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Whey fast protein, Banana & rice fast carbs for glycogen.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 2: Cottage Cheese (Paneer) & Rice Cakes with Honey
mealOptions.prepOverview: Spread cottage cheese on rice cakes. Drizzle honey, sprinkle cinnamon.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Cottage cheese casein, Rice cakes fast carbs, Honey quick energy.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 3: Whey Protein Smoothie with Oats & Banana
mealOptions.prepOverview: Blend all ingredients until smooth.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Whey fast protein, Oats & banana sustained carbs, Smoothie easy to digest.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 4: Brown Bread Sandwich with Peanut Butter & Banana
mealOptions.prepOverview: Spread peanut butter on bread slices. Layer banana. Make sandwich.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Brown bread sustained carbs, Peanut butter fats & protein, Banana quick carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 5: Greek Yogurt with Oats, Banana & Honey
mealOptions.prepOverview: Combine Greek yogurt, oats, banana, and honey in a bowl.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Greek yogurt casein & probiotics, Oats & banana carbs, Honey quick energy.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 6: Whey Protein & Brown Rice Pudding
ingredients: Brown Rice (cooked into pudding consistency - use more water/milk while cooking): 150g
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook brown rice into a pudding consistency. Stir in whey protein and cinnamon. Serve warm or cold.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Brown rice pudding comforting carbs, Whey protein fast protein, Warm option.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 7:  Paneer Bhurji with Brown Bread (small portion)
ingredients: Spices (Turmeric, Chili powder, Coriander powder, Garam Masala): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Prepare paneer bhurji (as in lunch option). Serve with one slice of brown bread.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Paneer bhurji savory protein, Brown bread carbs, Warm savory option.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 8:  Soya Chunks and Brown Rice Bowl (smaller portion)
mealOptions.prepTime: 25 mins (if soya chunks and rice are pre-cooked)
ingredients: Mixed Vegetables (Onion, Tomato, Broccoli, Cauliflower - pre-cooked): 70g
Spices (Turmeric, Cumin, Garlic powder): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Combine pre-cooked soya chunks, brown rice, and vegetables. Heat through. Season with spices.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Soya chunks plant-based protein, Brown rice complex carbs, Quick if ingredients pre-cooked.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 9:  Whey Protein Pancakes with Banana & Honey
ingredients: Whey Protein Pancake Mix (or homemade using whey protein, oats flour, almond milk - adjust ratios to macros): as per mix instructions for approx macros
mealOptions.prepOverview: Prepare whey protein pancakes as per mix instructions or homemade recipe. Top with banana slices and honey.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Protein pancakes dessert-like post-workout, Whey protein & carbs in pancake mix, Banana & honey extra carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 10:  Chickpea and Brown Rice Salad (warm or cold)
ingredients: Olive Oil & Balsamic Vinegar Dressing: 1 tbsp olive oil + 1 tsp balsamic vinegar
mealOptions.prepOverview: Combine cooked chickpeas, brown rice, and chopped vegetables. Dress with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Serve warm or cold.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Chickpeas plant-based protein, Brown rice complex carbs, Salad fresh and balanced.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 11:  Lentil and Brown Rice Bowl with Spices
ingredients: Spices (Cumin, Turmeric, Chili powder): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Heat olive oil, sauté onions with spices. Add cooked lentils and brown rice. Heat through.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Lentils plant-based protein, Brown rice complex carbs, Spiced for flavor.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 12:  Quinoa with Cottage Cheese and Berries
mealOptions.prepOverview: Combine cooked quinoa, cottage cheese, and berries. Drizzle honey if desired.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Quinoa complete protein, Cottage cheese casein, Berries antioxidants & carbs.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 13:  Pinto Bean and Brown Rice Burrito Bowl (deconstructed)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Combine cooked pinto beans, brown rice, chopped onion. Top with salsa and Greek yogurt.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Pinto beans plant-based protein, Brown rice complex carbs, Bowl style for easy eating.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 14:  Whey Protein & Corn on the Cob (small portion)
ingredients: Whey Protein Powder (flavor of choice): 1.5 scoops (approx. 45g powder)
Corn on the Cob: 1 small cob (approx. 150g cooked)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Prepare whey protein shake. Serve with cooked corn on the cob.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Whey protein fast protein, Corn easily digestible carbs, Simple and effective.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 15:  Rice Cakes with Peanut Butter and Honey (extra peanut butter)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Spread peanut butter on rice cakes. Drizzle honey.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Rice cakes fast carbs, Peanut butter healthy fats & some protein, Higher fat option for those who prefer.

mealSections.mealObjective: Continue muscle recovery, promote satiety for the evening, and provide sustained nutrient release during sleep.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 1: Paneer Tikka with Mixed Vegetables
ingredients: Mixed Vegetables (Bell Peppers, Onions, Tomatoes, Broccoli, Cauliflower): 150g
Spices (Turmeric, Paprika, Ginger, Garlic powder): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Marinate paneer, chop veggies. Grill/pan-fry paneer & veggies.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Paneer tikka flavorful protein & fats, Veggies fiber & vitamins, Lower carb dinner.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 2: Soya Chunks Stir-Fry with Sprouts
ingredients: Spices (Soy Sauce/Tamari, Ginger, Garlic, Chili flakes - optional): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Soak soya chunks, stir-fry onions, soya chunks & sprouts with spices.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Soya chunks plant-based protein, Sprouts nutrient-dense, Stir-fry quick cooking.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 3: Cottage Cheese (Paneer) Steak with Roasted Broccoli
ingredients: Olive Oil: 2 tbsp (30ml - 1 tbsp for paneer, 1 tbsp for broccoli)
Spices (Salt, Pepper, Garlic powder, Paprika): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Season paneer steaks and broccoli with spices and olive oil. Pan-fry or grill paneer steaks and roast broccoli until tender.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Paneer steak high protein & fats, Broccoli fiber & vitamins, Roasted veggies flavorful.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 4: Lentil and Vegetable Curry (Thick)
ingredients: Spices (Curry powder, Turmeric, Ginger, Garlic, Garam Masala): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook lentils thick. Sauté onions, add tomatoes & veggies, spices. Add lentils and simmer as thick curry.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Lentils plant-based protein & fiber, Veggies vitamins, Thick curry for satiety.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 5: Chickpea and Paneer Salad (Warm or Cold) with Olive Oil Dressing
ingredients: Mixed Vegetables (Onion, Tomato, Cucumber, Bell Peppers), chopped: 100g
Olive Oil Dressing: 2 tbsp (30ml) + Balsamic Vinegar (optional)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Combine chickpeas, paneer, and chopped vegetables. Dress with olive oil and balsamic vinegar (optional). Serve warm or cold.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Chickpeas & paneer protein, Salad fresh, Olive oil healthy fats.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 6:  Urad Dal (Black Gram) Curry (Thick) with Vegetables
ingredients: Urad Dal (Black Gram): 70g (dry weight, soaked and cooked)
Spices (Ginger, Garlic, Garam Masala, Turmeric, Bay leaf): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Cook urad dal thick. Prepare vegetable tadka with spices. Add veggies and cooked dal, simmer as thick curry.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Urad dal protein & fiber, Veggies vitamins, Thick curry hearty.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 7:  Paneer and Vegetable Skewers (Grilled or Pan-Fried)
ingredients: Mixed Vegetables (Bell Peppers, Onions, Tomatoes, Zucchini), cubed: 150g
Spices (Paprika, Oregano, Garlic powder, Lemon juice - acceptable condiment): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Marinate paneer and vegetables in spices and olive oil. Thread onto skewers. Grill or pan-fry skewers, brushing with olive oil.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Skewers fun and flavorful, Paneer & veggies protein & vitamins, Grilled/pan-fried for taste.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 8:  Moong Dal (Split Yellow Gram) Cheela (Pancake) with Paneer Filling
ingredients: Moong Dal (Split Yellow Gram): 60g (soaked and blended or Moong Dal flour)
Onion, finely chopped: 30g (for cheela batter and paneer filling)
Spices (Ginger, Garlic, Chili - for cheela, Spices for paneer filling): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Prepare moong dal cheela batter. Cook thin cheelas. Prepare paneer filling by sautéing onions and paneer with spices. Fill cheelas with paneer mixture.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Moong dal cheela savory base, Paneer filling high protein, Cheela & filling combined for meal.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 9:  Pinto Bean and Vegetable Stew (Thick)
ingredients: Mixed Vegetables (Carrots, Celery, Onions, Tomatoes, Cauliflower), chopped: 150g
Spices (Cumin, Oregano, Bay leaf, Salt, Pepper): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Sauté onions and vegetables in olive oil with spices. Add cooked pinto beans and broth/water. Simmer as thick stew.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Pinto beans plant-based protein & fiber, Stew hearty and warming, Veggies vitamins.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 10:  Toor Dal (Pigeon Peas) with Roasted Vegetables
ingredients: Toor Dal (Pigeon Peas): 60g (dry weight, soaked and cooked)
Mixed Vegetables (Broccoli, Cauliflower, Bell Peppers, Onions), cut into pieces: 150g
Olive Oil: 2 tbsp (30ml - 1 tbsp for roasting, 1 tbsp for dal tadka)
Spices (Turmeric, Mustard seeds, Curry leaves - optional, Ginger, Garlic): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Roast vegetables with 1 tbsp olive oil and spices. Cook toor dal. Prepare tadka for dal with mustard seeds, curry leaves (optional), ginger, garlic and 1 tbsp olive oil. Mix roasted vegetables with dal.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Toor dal protein & fiber, Roasted vegetables flavorful & nutritious, Dal tadka aromatic.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 11:  Black Bean and Corn Salsa with Cottage Cheese
mealOptions.prepOverview: Mix black beans, corn, salsa, and chopped onion to make salsa. Serve alongside cottage cheese.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Black beans plant-based protein, Corn carbs, Salsa flavor & veggies, Cottage cheese casein protein.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 12:  Paneer and Sprout Salad with Mustard Dressing
ingredients: Mustard Dressing: 2 tbsp Mustard + 1 tbsp Olive Oil + Balsamic Vinegar (optional)
mealOptions.prepOverview: Combine paneer, sprouts, and chopped vegetables. Prepare mustard dressing by whisking mustard, olive oil and balsamic vinegar (optional). Dress salad.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Paneer protein, Sprouts nutrient-dense, Salad fresh, Mustard dressing flavorful.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 13:  Kidney Bean Curry (Dry/Semi-Dry) with Vegetables
ingredients: Spices (Chili powder, Cumin, Coriander powder, Garam Masala): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Sauté onions, add tomatoes & bell peppers, spices. Add cooked kidney beans and cook as dry/semi-dry curry.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Kidney beans plant-based protein & fiber, Curry flavorful and savory, Veggies vitamins.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 14:  Cottage Cheese (Paneer) and Cauliflower "Rice" Bowl
ingredients: Olive Oil: 2 tbsp (30ml - 1 tbsp for paneer, 1 tbsp for cauliflower rice)
Spices (Turmeric, Cumin, Paprika, Garlic powder): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Sauté cauliflower rice in 1 tbsp olive oil with spices. Pan-fry or grill paneer cubes in 1 tbsp olive oil with spices. Serve paneer over cauliflower rice.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Cauliflower rice low carb base, Paneer protein & fats, Lower carb dinner bowl.

mealOptions.optionName: Option 15:  Paneer Tikka Masala (lighter version - less creamy) with Broccoli
mealOptions.prepTime: 45 mins (including tikka prep and masala prep)
ingredients: Cottage Cheese (Paneer), cubed: 150g (for tikka) + 50g (for masala) = 200g total
Tikka Masala Spices & Gravy Spices (adjust for lighter gravy - less cream/cashew, more tomato base, use acceptable spices): to taste
mealOptions.prepOverview: Prepare paneer tikka (marinate & grill/pan-fry). Prepare tikka masala gravy with onions, tomatoes, spices and a small amount of paneer for thickening (instead of cream/cashews). Add paneer tikka and broccoli to masala gravy.
mealOptions.interestingFacts: Paneer tikka masala flavorful but lighter version, Broccoli adds fiber & vegetables, Paneer protein.
